content:
I've been thinking about the overall aesthetic of the room, and I'd say it's a mix of modern and industrial chic. I've got a metal desk and chair, and I've added some industrial-style decor like metal lamp shades and a reclaimed wood shelf.

I really like the idea of adding some wooden bookcases to the room, but I'm not sure what style would work best. Do you think a modern wooden bookcase with clean lines and a minimalist design would work well, or should I opt for something a bit more rustic or distressed to match the industrial vibe?

Also, I'm wondering if you have any recommendations for bookshelf accessories like bookends or decorative objects that could add some visual interest to the shelves.
